django.core.serializers.base

Module for abstract serializer/unserializer base classes.

Attributes

DEFER_FIELD

Exceptions

SerializerDoesNotExist

The requested serializer was not found.

SerializationError

Something bad happened during serialization.

DeserializationError

Something bad happened during deserialization.

M2MDeserializationError

Something bad happened during deserialization of a ManyToManyField.

Abstract serializer base class.

Deserializer

Abstract base deserializer class.

A deserialized model.

Called to handle each individual (non-relational) field on an object.

getvalue()[source]

Return the fully serialized queryset (or None if the output stream is not seekable).

class django.core.serializers.base.Deserializer(stream_or_string, **options)[source]

Abstract base deserializer class.

options[source]
class django.core.serializers.base.DeserializedObject(obj, m2m_data=None, deferred_fields=None)[source]

A deserialized model.

Basically a container for holding the pre-saved deserialized data along with the many-to-many data saved with the object.

Call save() to save the object (with the many-to-many data) to the database; call save(save_m2m=False) to save just the object fields (and not touch the many-to-many stuff.)

object[source]
m2m_data = None[source]
deferred_fields = None[source]
save(save_m2m=True, using=None, **kwargs)[source]
save_deferred_fields(using=None)[source]
django.core.serializers.base.build_instance(Model, data, db)[source]

Build a model instance.

If the model instance doesn’t have a primary key and the model supports natural keys, try to retrieve it from the database.
